course_title: Working with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, Families and Communities

learning_outcomes.description: Appraise policies that have been put in place regarding decision making for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, families, and communities.
Critically discuss why Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples believe in the right to self-determination.
Analyse and evaluate the impact of historical and contemporary policies and contexts on the health and wellbeing of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, families, and communities.
Develop an understanding of culturally safe, responsive and respectful practice and its importance in working with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, families, and communities.
Develop strategies for effective communication and collaboration with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities to address health and social issues.
Critically reflect on your personal and professional cultures, values and beliefs and how these may impact your practice.

assessments.assessment_title: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Quality Appraisal Tool
assessments.task_description:
This task requires you to:

1. Utilise the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Quality Appraisal Tool and the companion document to interpret and assess two (2) research articles provided to you (available on UQ Learn/Blackboard under the Assessment Tab). These chosen research articles involve or are related to research on/for/with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, families, and communities.

2. Complete two (2) Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Quality Appraisal Tools - For each article, respond to the 14 questions in the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Quality Appraisal Tool. Provide some evidence on the tool to justify your response to “yes/no/maybe”

3. Provide a detailed and justified response for each article (250 words each) that demonstrates your understanding of the tool and your ability to critically appraise the research articles. In your response:

  • Evaluate the researcher’s engagement with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities,
  • Identify and discuss potential risks and benefits of the research for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, families, and communities,
  • Demonstrate your understanding of key ethical principles and cultural safety in the context of working with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, families, and communities,
  • Reflect on the importance of utilising a quality appraisal tool to guide ethical research with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, families and communities.

It is a requirement that you upload the completed Quality Appraisal Tools along with your two justification responses. Please note that only the justification response will be counted towards the word count limit.

Complete task sheets & marking rubrics will be accessed via Blackboard.
assessments.submission_guidelines: All courses require students to submit an electronic version of their assignment via blackboard. A link will be made available in the Assessment area of Blackboard to allow you to submit your assignment electronically.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This task requires you to:  

  1. Define cultural safety and culturally safe practice: Explain the concepts of cultural safety and culturally safe practice. Position yourself personally and professionally on your journey towards culturally safe practice. Provide insight as to why you are at this stage of the journey to cultural safety.  
  2. Examine Professional Standards and Codes: Analyse your professional standards and codes of ethics to understand how they address cultural safety. Consider whether these guidelines provide adequate support for culturally safe practice. 
  3. Evaluate and Suggest Improvements: Critically evaluate the extent to which your professional standards and codes effectively promote cultural safety. Identify any gaps or weaknesses and propose specific recommendations for improvement. 

Complete task sheets & marking rubrics will be accessed via Blackboard.

assessments.due_date:
End of Semester Exam Period

7/06/2025 - 21/06/2025

Date will be available when exam dates are released.
assessments.task_description:
This task requires you to apply course content for the semester to this assessment. Questions for this exam will be sourced from the following: 

  • Lectures 
  • Tutorials 
  • Online modules 
  • UQ Extend 
  • Required readings 

You are required to complete an invigilated, digital examination on campus. The exam will consist of: 

  • Twenty (20) x Multiple Choice Questions 
  • Four (4) x short answer questions (250 words each).  
  • One (1) x short essay (500 words) 

In Week 11 a case study will be shared to UQ Learn. This case study will be used as stimulus, along with your course learnings to answer the short essay prompt.  

Complete task sheets will be accessed via Blackboard.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Inspera Assessment is an online assessment tool used in courses at UQ. Inspera has a wide range of question types and accessibility provisions, Inspera is cloud-based, works with a device with an up-to-date browser, and caches your responses so that you will not lose your assessment if you experience internet instability. If you have any concerns with Inspera during the exam please alert the exam supervisor.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
